website_summaries.verdict: This hearty ceramic unit offers 3 drinking levels for animals of all ages. Dependable and durable.
pros: Includes carbon filters and three drinking options

customer_reviews.title: It bubbles like a fountain and you'll hear it. But it's pleasant.
customer_reviews.text: We learned that the reason cats don't use a cat fountain is that they don't like water next to their food. This is the reason that the cat - especially our Fussy Bad Cat - will chase you into the bathroom and leap into the bathtub, rubbing their head on the bath water spout. They want THAT water, nothing near their food. We got this bc it's the most attractive (white ceramic vs green plastic) and largest of the fountains we could find. And the dog uses it too.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy for Aussie Dogs

customer_reviews.title: Best quality fountain out there!!
customer_reviews.text: Best quality water bowl I’ve even used!! Don’t spend money on the “cheaper” plastic water fountains. Just go straight for this high quality ceramic one. I had another plastic brand that was constantly covered in slime and no matter what brush I used I could not get all the slime out of the millions of pieces and crevices. My one caveat with this model is the noise level... but thanks to other reviewers I fixed it asap but putting 2 plates in fountain then ordered these fish tank rocks from here, and now perfection!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Fountain... Except for Noise
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with this fountain. It was so easy to assemble and clean. But the noise drove me crazy. The pump is very quiet, but the water hitting the bowl is incredibly distracting. If you have someplace out of the way, this is a great fountain. I unfortunately have to keep it in the kitchen, and the fountain is way too noisy. Returning item.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C Norman

customer_reviews.title: Cats love this!
customer_reviews.text: Hubby hated the noise, but the cats love the fountain! Personally, I love the sound, so I have it in my home office. There are a number of other reviews that show how to reduce the noise. I tend to be a low maintenance person, so I was concerned I would find it a chore to clean, but it is super simple. I do recommend having a small bottle brush, though a small finger can clean the hole just fine. I skipped the apparently troublesome inner filter and because we have very hard water, I use bottled drinking water.
customer_reviews.author: Suzette C. Dollar

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, smaller than I imagined.
customer_reviews.text: I like the ceramic construction. I can tell it’s going to be easier to clean than my plastic 80oz pet safe water fountain. My cat is only on day one with it so it will take some time to completely wean him off the sink water but so far so good. I’m not a fan of how noisy the water splashing down is but i remedied the issue by adding some mini containers to the base.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Dish
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my cat likes fountains. But I recently moved to an area where the humidity is high. So bacteria does grow and biofilms in it very quickly (in less than a week). At least it did over the summer. I'm planning to try it again soon this fall / winter. It wasn't due to any defect in the product at all. It depends on the climate and common bacteria cultures where you live. In more dry climates, I notice these work much better. It is very easy to clean. This is the first time I bought a ceramic one and I'm pleased overall with the design, ease of use, and easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: At first it was great, but beware you will have to clean it ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a couple of months now. At first it was great, but beware you will have to clean it every week as it gets slimy quickly. Second, keep your written instructions as they are different/better than the one online. Finally go ahead and order more filters, etc right off the bat. The problem is that it worked great until today and the water flow is soooo slow. I took it apart AGAIN and cleaned it and it's still a low flow. I'm going to wait to see if it will magically start working again or give up all together. I've changed my rating. It's already stopped working. For $80 that is soooo disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Rebbecca

customer_reviews.title: Hesitant at first, but LOVE it! (Buying a second one)
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, the semi-steep price made me hesitant at first; however, after reading all the positive reviews & "taking the plunge" ...I LOVE IT! As a matter of fact, I'm likely buying a second one! Setup was easy (following pictured instruction manual), quality appears MUCH better than those I've seen for half the price, and the style accents almost any decor; moreover, it's verrrrry quiet/tranquil (so much that I've placed on my nightstand)! Now the only question would be: Should the second one be red? Hmmm..
customer_reviews.author: Ruben M

customer_reviews.title: Water sounds and charcoal residue
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, our cats didn't take to this fountain. As other reviewers have noted, this fountain is really loud. But if our cats liked it, or used it at all in the few weeks we kept it, I wouldn't have returned it because of the noise. Both of our cats are super into water sounds and running water in general, and they enjoy the other fountains we have, so I'm not sure why they didn't like this one. It might be the charcoal filter... No matter how much I rinsed it, it continued to leave a film/residue in the fountain.
customer_reviews.author: albgrj

customer_reviews.title: Carefully consider before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to clean scale off of ceramic - abrasive scrubbing damaged clear protective coating of ceramic. Assembly instructions bad - assembly videos were much better. Cats never used fountain. All in all, a total waste of money. Is smaller than I expected. Photos led me to believe there was ample space between water fall and side of lower bowl portion. I suspect the reason the cats didn't like it is there's not enough room around the center tower for them to get their heads into the bowl. Was hoping to find a semi-attractive water fountain, but this was a total waste of money for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Works great & easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pet water fountain we have gone through and this is by far the best. The plastic ones get a ton of build up and are hard to clean. The metal one is hard to clean and the plastic parts were falling apart. This one is awesome! The ceramic is super easy to clean and there is minimal parts inside to clean making it quick and easy. It is a little louder that other ones I have had but it just sounds like a little water fountain. Recommend for anyone looking for a pet fountain that will actually last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Snoddy

customer_reviews.title: Significant improvement over plastic
customer_reviews.text: This fountain is a huge step up from their plastic version specifically in regards to bacterial control. More filters and seals are big help, ceramic cleans up.much better than plastic esp with high mineral water. however, noise level higher, stream more forceful. One cat uses it, another won't. 😏 However, I can enjoy the sound of a lovely stream of water inside my home.! 😄 Takes me approx 15 mins to thoroughly clean and reassemble.
customer_reviews.author: Anne S

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, but difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a beautiful fountain but I will say it is so time consuming to clean. I have multiple cats and keeping the water fresh for them was a chore with this. Every few days, I would have to completely disassemble and run the ceramic pieces through the sanitizing wash in my dishwasher. The motor and smaller parts require a tiny bristle or bottle brush to keep mold from growing. I ended up not using it because I was afraid or bacteria and mold. Better off with a ceramic bowl that is easy to wash and sanitize than going through the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved
customer_reviews.text: The Pro's. The cats love it and its much nicer looking than my Drinkwell stainless fountain. It goes well with all decor and just looks classier than most cat fountains. It seems to stay cleaner longer too. I think it's easier to assemble and disassemble the large round stainless fountain its' replacing. The Con's. It's labeled porcelain not ceramic. Not a biggie, but it surprised me as it's advertised as ceramic. It is very heavy, and of course more breakable than the stainless.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Vespa

customer_reviews.title: 4 animals, 4 ways to drink
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely glad all of my "babies" are drinking more water. 3 cats - one VERY picky. 1 small dog. My oldest drinks from the downpour, one cat at the small back (I offset the pagoda) the dog in the larger front and my picky one drinks from the moving water at the top. Maybe a little harder to clean than just a bowl; but, everyone likes it. Sometimes at night we unplug the pump, if we forget to plug it in Rusty will sit and look at you then his bowl.... very cute.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, but cats did not like
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this fountain is very nice, but the falling water is noisy (the motor is silent). At first I thought it was a calming sound, but after a while it did get annoying. More importantly: our two cats did not like the sound at all. They wouldn't eat their food placed next to fountain unless I unplugged the fountain; even then they still wouldn't drink out of it. I was hoping this would be a good solution to get them to drink filtered (recirculated through a filter) water, but they weren't having it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pets enjoy the fountain
customer_reviews.text: Only problem is buy plenty of filters as they will restrict over time. And you will have to take apart and clean periodically as you would expect on anything. It will accumulate some green grime in the pump housing if you decide to run without the charcol filter you just have to change water daily. But it's a good buy.. The porccelin is good quality and heavy. My Chihuahua and Cat liked it. If the burbling noise bothers you just put it in another room. Did buy extra motor for backup. Goal is to keep the babies fresh clean water and entertain them too
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this product. I purchased this is March of 2016 and it has just stopped working. The ceramic stains and it's disgusting. I wanted the best for my pet; unfortunately, this is not the best. Wish I could make this a no-star. I am going to contact the manufacturer and see what kind of recourse is available. Very inconvenient! I should have purchased a third Cat-It. Much cheaper and longer lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Katie

customer_reviews.title: Really like it but noisy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cat who will not drink water without a fountain. Our previous one was the stainless steel raindrop fountain. I knew that I didn’t want another stainless one. I did a lot of searching and chose this one. So far i am very happy with it. However as most other reviews say this thing is LOUD. At first I thought I would have to return it but we have gotten used to it. I keep it in the kitchen but if it was close to the bedroom I would have returned it because of the noise.
customer_reviews.author: pc2425

customer_reviews.title: Even our scaredy-cat uses it!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced our plastic DrinkWell with this because I don’t like to use plastic for me or for our kitties. Set up of this was quick and I barely needed the instructions. I like being able to wash this in hot water until it’s squeaky clean. Our four cats adopted this immediately and have been drinking more water since we’ve had it. It’s interesting to see the different favorite spots each cat has chosen to drink. Some love the flowing water, some drink from the well in the top and my little short girl drinks from the main resevoir. Highly recommend this as an addition to a healthy pet environment.
customer_reviews.author: Maryland Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Gets dirty really fast
customer_reviews.text: I've had several cat fountains over the years and this one, as pretty as it is, is the worst! It seems to stay dirty and it has a ring around the water line that just doesn't want to come off. My cats like drinking from a stream but this doesn't really make a strong enough stream to drink from. They have to drink from the bubbles at the top. I know that's not a real hardship for them but I was trying to get something they would enjoy. They prefer the bathtub faucet to this.
customer_reviews.author: Faerynuff

customer_reviews.title: This fountain sounds like a water feature in a spa it's so loud.
customer_reviews.text: This fountain is a perfect size for cats, is beautifully designed and very easy to put together. The porcelain will be much easier to clean with my hard water than the stainless steel fountain I am replacing. However. It's really really loud. Not the pump, that's silent. It just has a very strong water flow over 2 spouts on the sides, so you are going to hear a brook like splashing running water kind of sound. Some may find it relaxing, others may find it annoying. I'm going to try it out for a few more days to see if it turns into white noise or if it has to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Jan D

customer_reviews.title: Great but only last a year
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this fountain type for four years. My two cats love it. It is easy to set up and replace filters which I do regularly. The problem is every year on the dot the pump dies and by then the calcium buildup on the ceramic is so bad that I just buy a whole new one instead of buying a replacement pump. So yeah I’ve spent close to $400 which is so frustrating. The price tag doesn’t warrant how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: fromthevalley

customer_reviews.title: Nice drinking fountain....our cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised with the good packaging and quality of the fountain. Assembly took a little longer than I would have liked, but the instructions were well written with good pictures. The ceramic is of good quality, and the pump is very quiet! I can not hear the pump when the fountain is running. Now the best part, our cat loves it! 6 Months Later: Our cat still likes the fountain, but seems like we are going thru a lot of filters. We have lots of minerals in our area and it seems like they cause the filters to wear out quickly. We are replacing about once every 4-6 weeks or so... This is our one disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: PacNW

customer_reviews.title: Pump fell apart after only 6 weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but I feel like people should know that this fountain is not well made at all. The actual propeller in the pump started crumbling after only a few weeks of use. I'm not sure what the metal-like material is that surrounds the propeller (the manufacturer stated that it's not actual metal), but it started chipping away and crumbling. Thankfully I caught it in time so it wasn't ingested by my kitten, but still, really unsettling. I am out of my 45 day return window and I definitely do not want a replacement, so it's a loss. I'm just glad it didn't hurt my pet.
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: It stays cleaner longer than non ceramic fountains and is very easy to clean....
customer_reviews.text: I have had several ‘flowing’ pet water fountains and this one is the only one that my two kitties, Dougal and Lily use frequently without hesitation. Furthermore, Lily would always use her paw to drink from, but this fountain she will sup straight from the pour. The only thing that I find distracting is the sound of the water flowing from the spout—-but that’s because where I live, its extremely quiet, that issue notwithstanding, I wouldn’t change it for anything else, it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Domestic goddess

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant Fountain
customer_reviews.text: Attractive, clean, unobtrusive appearance. Pleasant water sound, the motor seems fairly silent. Fascinating to the kitty. Easy to assemble. Good, descriptive instructions. Well-packaged to protect the product during transit. I appreciate that the fountain's power cord can go through the side or the back. I appreciate that replacement parts are easy to come by should I ever need them. The fountain's footprint is a bit larger than I'd like for my small space, but it is one of the smallest ceramic fountains I could find.
customer_reviews.author: chromodynamica

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I had another fountain (stainless steel) and liked it, but boy it was work to clean, and just to line up the pump, don't even ask! I wanted something (not plastic) and this is ceramic. I have been using it for several months with no problems, and my cat took to this one fast. I like the quiet motor, the size, the easy cleanup, and the filters are great (I get them from another source, which seems to be better than the company's filters - look on Amazon, you will see the different ones offered) I am including a video too (if it is not too large). I totally recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Use as a water dish first so cats get used to it
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect water fountain. Easy to put together, as quiet as it can be, and your cat will never be able to tip it over, which has always been an issue with water dishes in our house. I would recommend filling it, but not plugging it in until your cats become comfortable drinking from it like a water dish. Then plug it in and this will avoid any initial fear they may have.
customer_reviews.author: foster cat home

customer_reviews.title: Decorative, spa soothing level noise
customer_reviews.text: Love it it’s pretty enough as a decorative piece in the house even can be used on a sideboard but you’ll need to add some kind of material under it in case the furniture gets wet. Easy assembly and cleaning. There is a slight noise one factor depending on how much water is used but it’s not bothersome to me it’s similar to a spa water soothing sound in the background.
customer_reviews.author: MIA

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves dripping water from the faucet, so I thought he’d love this product. He’s scared of it... The flow is much more than a dribble, and I definitely didn’t expect it to be so loud. Not worth the price for sure! Also, the basin is too small for a pet to get their face into to drink while the water is running. I wish the basin was larger (wider) and the motor was adjustable—I’d like to be able to turn the flow down so there’s only a dribble of water, rather than a stream.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: I loved the first one I purchased several years ago
customer_reviews.text: I loved the first one I purchased several years ago. When I chipped it, I bought the same one, and let me tell you, it was not the same. It was cheaply made and it smelled so bad when I took it out of the box. Everything in the box smelled like pesticide, the plastic bags that the parts were in, and the actual pieces of the fountain. It was thinner, the porcelain was cheap with the seems showing. I sent it back. Now am looking for a new fountain for my cat that won't kill him from pesticide sprayed on it for shipping. Anyone have any suggestions? Only looking for ceramic not plastic of stainless.
customer_reviews.author: NanBaker

customer_reviews.title: well made fountain
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, this fountain didn't work for my kitty. I had such high hopes. She drinks from the bathroom faucet, so with this one she couldn't figure out how to angle her head to drink from it. She kept getting her head wet. I will keep using it and hope she figures out, eventually, how to navigate it. Maybe if the center stem were thinner she would be able to turn her head sideways, like she does in the sink, and drink but not get wet. If all else fails I'll have a pretty meditation fountain.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Nothing
customer_reviews.text: Another reviewer suggested adding 4-inch tiles under the downspouts. This makes the fountain virtually silent (no fountain is completely silent - pump hum.) Only one little problem - my two rescue cats won't touch it. Hence the three star rating. It is no more difficult to clean than any other fountain, but the filters are expensive and must be replaced. It is, overall, a good fountain if your cat will use it.
customer_reviews.author: Walrus

customer_reviews.title: finally just threw it in the garbage
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend this product. Too much maintenance, and just a pain. Every corner and crevice gets coated in black algae every 3 days.. charcoal filter lasted about a week, and I ended up ordering a 12 pack of the foam filters that surround the pump because they get really unusable (I use bottled water). Dissembling this unit takes more time than you really want to spend, especially knowing it will require the same attention in a few days. Black cable is unsightly, it's a little too big in my opinion, and the pump just stopped working after 4 months. Kittens seemed to like it ok, but finally just threw it in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Biloba

customer_reviews.title: My dog would not drink from this until I got ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog would not drink from this until I got down on my knees and pretended to drink from it. Bingo, that was all she had to see. Can't keep her away from it now. She loves it when I add ice cubes to the water. As others have stated the motor goes quickly. We washed the filter out, but instead of putting it back in we tried operating it without the filter and it is back to normal. The filter messes this up not the motor. We use our Reverse Osmosis water so it is already purified before being put in the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Horn

customer_reviews.title: Great water bowl
customer_reviews.text: This is a great water bowl, I have two dogs and a cat and they all use it. You can hear it pouring but I don’t mind that sound because it is relaxing like a fountain. When it gets dirty, it is super easy to clean. I also purchased extra filters and the white band that goes around the filter to catch Debris and hair. I usually change the filter once a month. The bands can last longer, I didn’t realize it needed a new band until the water got slow when pouring.
customer_reviews.author: ac333

customer_reviews.title: It's not loud at all.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Havanese because he's super picky about his water and is always jumping in the bathtub and licking the faucet until I turn the water on for him. I used to have a stainless steel fountain, but they stopped making filters that fit, so I just decided to get a new one. Setup was super easy. I was worried about the noise due to all the reviews, but honestly, it's quieter than my old one. I don't even hear the pump, just the water and even that's pretty quiet. My dog liked it right away, so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell if they like it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this since my cats don’t like the glass water bowls and want to drink out of the kitchen faucet. Yes it is incredibly noisy if you run it as it is designed. I followed the advice of another review and I bought 2 4 inch high shot glasses. The noise completely goes away if you install a shot glass under each stream to avoid the loud trickling water sound. Works like a charm. All I need to do now is wait and see how my cats like it.
customer_reviews.author: Peabarter

customer_reviews.title: The pet fountain we have been searching for
customer_reviews.text: Had aplastic fountain from Petco prior. I was on the fence about buying this one and am so glad I did! It looks like a relaxation fountain so fits my home better. And the quality is top notch. It has a strong steady flow. Makes a soothing sound. The water stream is more pronounced so my cats are obsessed with it. They drink so much more water. Easy to clean easy to assemble. Tip: we added avocado pots to the basin to reduce mold/scum and it works!
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoBoho

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: My older one got a crack from a boot so I went searching for another 1, very happy I found this one. I kept the new motor and the plastic pieces for when the others wear out. My cat loves her fountain that she had a hard time drinking from a non fountain water even though it's filtered. So very happy I the fountain fast. Will buy again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jan M. Stuve

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, I have a tip to eliminate splashing sound
customer_reviews.text: Cats take a few days to trust it and drink from it, so give it some time. I use distilled water because otherwise you get scale deposit on sides, which can be cleaned off but it can be avoided in first place with distilled water, which isn't very expensive. Some people complain about the splashing sound, but I found a way to virtually eliminate it. Use the clear, extra wide Breathe Right nasal strips ( and stick one on either side right under the overflow streams. If you bend the strip right, it will deflect the water stream back towards the center pagoda and eliminate the splash sound. I've uploaded a couple pictures to show this.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Cleans super easy if you have hard water.
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased a lot of plastic pet water fountains and our hard water has always roached them. This fountain is soooo easy to clean. Just fill up a bucket with water and vinegar, let sit for 10 minutes and scrub all the scum off. It’s amazing and I’m so glad we purchased this. Every time we wash it it looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel & Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Weak water pump and filter makes this a poor fountain
customer_reviews.text: Pros:. My cat likes drinking from it. Took her a few weeks but now she loves it. Nice design, size is nice, not too big, not too small. Cons: The water pump Is unreliable and weak. Expect to replace the pump often The poor filter design. It's very dense and makes the weak water pump fail to produce any force after a few days. Until they come up with a better filtering OR come with a stronger, more reliable water pump, I'd pass on this fountain.
customer_reviews.author: Mr CK

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it & drink more
customer_reviews.text: Both of my cats are drinking a lot more water with this fountain. I love how it looks and is very easy to clean unlike my last fountain that always had residue from the charcoal filter in the water. The noise is annoying. It's a very loud fountain but not unbearable. I may try some of the other remedies in previous posts to lower the noise. The cats don't mind it.
customer_reviews.author: trmiller21

customer_reviews.title: Cat and dog didn't like the water.  I didn't like the noise.
customer_reviews.text: My cat and dog would only drink from the basin, not the waterfall part. What's the point? My dog still preferred his bowl. Noisier than I liked. When the basin is less than an inch from the basin's lip the motor gets noisier and noisier. Like, really loud. So, I was needing to fill it several times a day, which I'm not into, so it wouldn't be so noisy. It was attractive and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: FabGnat

customer_reviews.title: nice looking but LOUD
customer_reviews.text: I've been through a number of fountains. This is by far the nicest looking, and the ceramic is nice as well. My cats liked it. But boy is it LOUD! I live in a large one-bedroom apartment, and I'd wake up in the morning thinking it was pouring rain outside, until I remembered ... oh, the cat fountain. I had to unplug it whenever I wanted to read, because the hyper-gurgling would drive me mad. I finally had to retire this in favor of one the Wirecutter recommended, which is plastic, but doesn't drive me crazy sound-wise. (The cats are OK with that one, too.)
customer_reviews.author: kriserts

customer_reviews.title: Your cat may not be into this...
customer_reviews.text: I will say this fountain looks really nice. my cat doesn't seem to agree with this sentiment. I have a pretty easy cat - she eats just about anything (that's a different problem), and she has never had an issue drinking from any bowl or fountain I've put on the floor. That being said, she was trying to drink out of the toilet rather than use this fountain. Desperate times indeed. It's pretty loud, and she just doesn't seem to either like the noise, or for whatever reason want to use it. I turn it off now half of the time to make sure she gets the water she needs, my hope is that she will adjust eventually...
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, quiet, but plastic taste!
customer_reviews.text: I love this fountain, but I rarely see my cats drink from it. And my dog won't. There's a strong plastic smell/taste that I hope I can eventually get rid of. I cleaned it initially, (and tear down and clean it weekly) and replace water daily. I may put it out of sight for a while and re-introduce it again in a few weeks. If that doesn't work, I guess it'll just be for decoration. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Healthy animals
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd Pagoda. They are great. Dogs definitely drink more water. Broke the last one by accident. Minerals eat away at porcelain but sane thing happens on the plastic ones. Wish it was quieter.
customer_reviews.author: L_K

customer_reviews.title: best for pets
customer_reviews.text: I love the ceramic for my pets to drink from. The sound is calming since we have it in our master bedroom so both our dog and cat can drink from it anytime. I haven't had any trouble cleaning it and bought extra filters for it. Using filtered water to fill it so it lasts longer between cleanings. Still some fear when I must pick it up to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: kaylove

customer_reviews.title: Best Fountain I’ve Ever Purchased, Super Easy to Clean!
customer_reviews.text: Soooo much easier to clean than other pet drinking fountains I’ve purchased! What a difference between the previous plastic model- the Petwell drinking fountain- and this one! I love the ceramic! It doesn’t stain like plastic, and there are no tricky hard to reach spaces to clean. I like to do a quick scrub with a baby bottle brush every three or four days, (sooner if I see food dropped in), just to make sure the water stays clean. Most of it can also go in the dishwasher, but I haven’t had to do that yet. Simple to put together, easy to clean and enjoyed by a big cat.
customer_reviews.author: StripeyS

customer_reviews.title: I paid $59 for this item. It's selling for $89 at the time of this review only 2 wks after purchase
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how to review this product. It is beautiful. It is loud. It is as advertised. I paid $59 for it on Dec. 7th and it's currently selling for $89 on Dec. 28th. It's not worth $89.00. It may be worth $59, but I'm not totally sold on that. My pets refuse to use it. I'll probably re-purpose it and put some plants in it.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: pump is pathetic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an "upgrade" from my tried and true but not so pretty plastic pet fountain. It looks great! But I can't get this thing to keep working. I have taken it apart, put it back together again, cleaned it (I am used to cleaning the pet fountain 1-2 times a week). This pretty thing only gets up to a pathetic trickle & that's only occasionally. Wishing I had held on to the old ugly for a bit while I tried out that new pretty. Forgive me old ugly, I know better now!!!
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, easy to clean... but the pump stops working after like 12 hours. You have to clean and reprise the pump every time. When the pump is actually working it’s so aggressive it splatters water every where but no worries in not too long it’s so weak it doesn’t even pour from the threshold. I can’t believe what a massive waste of money this was. I was excited about the porcelain with a pre filter to keep hair from destroying the pump but the pump is pre-crap. How dare they charge so much for such a cheap worthless water pump.
customer_reviews.author: Ayris

customer_reviews.title: Your pet will love it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised to see so many low scores for this item. I love it, and so does Artemis (cat). She drinks much more than she ever did from a standing bowl. The trickle noise is very noticeable, but I live in Brooklyn New York. It's loud outside with a constant hum of The City, and the fountain cancels out a huge amount of outside noise. I have it next to my meditation chair so it adds an extra level of present relaxation sound. It does have to be cleaned regularly for it to work properly. The charcoal filters aren't expensive. Your pet will love it!
customer_reviews.author: JoshuaNYC78

customer_reviews.title: Pretty heavy but good fountain
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice fountain FOR SOMEONE ELSE. The ceramic is more hygienic than plastic- but it weighs a lot (for me) & I almost dropped many times while cleaning. It also has a lot more parts than the plastic fountain I sent it back for. Returned for Pioneer fountain- few parts - light weight- very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Gaby

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the Pagoda Pet Fountain!
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound of this pagoda fountain. And my dogs and cats like it too (2 of each)! Signed up for the auto-delivery of filters. Think I will enjoy receiving filters in time to replace them. And, I think the pagoda will be SO easy to clean, either in the dishwasher or out. Very happy with the purchase of the pagoda. Update - This is a wonderful fountain. So much easier to clean compared to the last fountain I had. At least one of my two cats is now drinking from the "fountain" and not the bowl. And, it LOOKS so clean compared to the plastic fountain I had been using.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Our cat likes to drink from the faucet so this product satisfies his need to do so. At first he was drinking out of the bowl but now he drinks from the trickle of it. It is a little loud, so we turn it off before going to bed. It sounds like a water fountain, so it can be soothing. We put filtered water in it so the filter it came with doesn't get clogged like many of the reviews. Can run just fine without the filter in it. Being ceramic it is easy to clean. Overall we are very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If the spouts were narrower it'd be perfect
customer_reviews.text: It is loud, as others have pointed out. The shape amplifies and distributes the sound of water hitting water, and the spouts are too broad, so it comes gurgling out rather than in more coherent streams. I sleep with sounds of nature playing on the stereo, but this is a still bit louder than I'd like it, so beware. I suppose putting plates in it would silence it, but they also kind of destroy the reasons for having one (aesthetics and the cat likes the stream). White ceramic is easy to clean. Haven't had issues with clogging.
customer_reviews.author: Saxon

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this fountain!
customer_reviews.text: For now, I only set up the fountain in order to see how my 8 cats like it (I need to add cord protection due to a cord chewer!). But so far...I LOVE this fountain! It's everything I expected it to be. It is very attractive and well made. I love the variety of drinking options: drink from the bubbler in the center, or from the right or left waterfall, sip from the lower level pooling area. The fountain makes the perfect amount of soothing waterfall sound and is very relaxing to hear. My kitties were very curious about the fountain and I believe it will encourage them to drink more water.
customer_reviews.author: CPGirleeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nice fountain, but internal filter clogsi
customer_reviews.text: I like the compact size and looks of the fountain. Initially the fountain worked well, but the water stream slowed to nothing in about 2 weeks. Cleaning the filter helped for only a few days. ( Using no filter results in too strong and loud of a stream). After you clean the filter, the stream can be noisy with the water stream falling directly into the water rather than onto the vertical tower.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L

customer_reviews.title: No Go for a Playful Kitty
customer_reviews.text: This is a busy for my cat. She headbutts the center and easily knocks it off the pump rendering it useless. It's unstable in the middle to begin with, but even less stable if you have a playful, active pet. It's going up into the cupboard, which is sad because it's cute.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: My kitty loves loves this fountain. She was scared of it the first couple of days but finally got up the courage to investigate and now been more than a month of use and she loves it. I didn’t put in the charcoal filter after reading other reviews and it’s working perfectly. The sound of water doesn’t bother me (I find it peaceful), but it is pronounced so if that would bother you, probably best not to buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Christi C.

customer_reviews.title: Great fountain, but 3 pumps died in one year.
customer_reviews.text: I actually love the pagoda. It's beautiful, and with a little vinegar any hard water buildup goes away immediately. Unfortunately, since I bought this thing less than a year ago, i've had to get 3 replacement pumps, and the last one just blew as well. I hope petsafe figures out they have a quality issue with their water pumps and resolves the issue. I follow all the cleaning instructions and nothing is getting in the water to obstruct the pump, they're just garbage.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: So far we really like this ceramic fountain compared to our plastic ones in ...
customer_reviews.text: So far we really like this ceramic fountain compared to our plastic ones in the past. It seems to be worth the extra cost. My husband is stuck with the job of periodic cleaning, but he said it is easier to clean than our previous ones. It seems to stay cleaner longer. It is fairly quiet unless it is low on water. My cats were wary at first, but it wasn't long before they were lapping up the fresh bubbling water. One cat drinks from the top and my other cat drinks from the sides. I like that it gives them 3 choices of where to drink from.
customer_reviews.author: Debra J. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had to give this one star, because I have to give it SOMETHING We bought this fountain and it died within a few months. Amazon was wondeful and replaced it for us. We recieved the new fountain in February 2017. It is now the first week of June 2017 and it died AGAIN! We ONLY ever use filtered water. And we take it all apart and clean it, with the special brushes reccommended for this fountain every three weeks. And it STILL died in just just barely over 3 months! And this is not a cheap pet fountain! So not worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: v.rogers

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, my cats love it and so easy to maintain! A+
customer_reviews.text: I have six cats. We had purchased another brand and it stopped working within three months. This one is a little more expensive but so worth it. Our cats love it! There are two good size streams of water on either side and they like drinking from both. The fact that this fountain is ceramic makes it much nicer looking than others and the best part is it cannot be easily knocked over or damaged. It is very well made and very easy to put together. A+
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Trick to make the fountain quieter...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because kitty was always standing in the sink demanding a fresh drink. She loves it and I love the fact it's easy to clean. If you don't thoroughly rinse the carbon filters they will leave a black ring. It is rather noisy but I put a piece of floss around the rubber stopper where the water bubbles out. Now the noise is a tolerable level. Thank you to my high school physics teacher!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah_Bellum

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: Our Maine Coon absolutely LOVES this fountain and drinks from it often. We clean it every few weeks (not difficult) and to save on any issues with filtration, we only put already filtered water in it. It's louder than we were expecting but moving it to another room helped and we now love the relaxing sound of it throughout the day. Also, just to extend the life of it, we turn it off when sleeping. Our cats runs to it when we turn it on every morning.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly J. Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: Too loud
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, however, there is no way to regulate the water flow and it is VERY loud. I put pieces of plastic under each spout to minimize the splash and make it tolerable. The filter gets FILTHY very quickly. I can see going through a fortune in filters. I would have returned it, but my husband had already thrown away the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Algae Factory
customer_reviews.text: My cats took one sip and never touched the water again. This fountain produces a large amount of algae sludge within two days despite disassembly and thorough cleaning. It's not kept in sunlight or humidity and there should be no reason for this amount of growth. I can only surmise that I received a previously used unit that had already been populated with this algae and it just continued to reproduce. I'm going to try once more with replacing all parts because even though the cats hate it, I like to listen to the sound of the water.
customer_reviews.author: Missy Anne

customer_reviews.title: Not for me (or my cat)
customer_reviews.text: I want ceramic because safer for my cat and I have had waterfall type pet bowls before but never one this loud. If this is anywhere where you will hear it, don't buy it. It will drive you crazy. My cat has not taken to it yet either but I don't know why. Maybe the loud noise of the water? Good quality but I like the ones where you can put an extra reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: SD GAL

customer_reviews.title: This is THE water fountain for cats !
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased this fountain a couple months ago after a few years of searching for one that the cats would like, would withstand a little nudging and batting, and was EASY TO CLEAN / ASSEMBLE... I'm happy to say this is it ! Plus the sound of the trickling water provides a nice, calming background sound ... and the cats have ample room to drink from the ceramic surrounding square bowl. This is the second one we've gotten for ample placement in the house .... we are thinking about a third ...... We highly recommend this fountain - and Amazon is the place to purchase - competing pet stores want $100.
customer_reviews.author: L. Germony

customer_reviews.title: Motor life about 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a water fountain to provide my pets continually running water. The fountain itself came as advertised and worked well for about six months. Then, despite cleaning the fountain weekly and changing the filter every two weeks, the motor simply stopped working. Now I have an $80 rectangular water bowl. If I bought it from a brick and mortar I'd just return it. But after six months repackaging it and returning it to the seller is more hassle than it's worth. If you're thinking about spending money for a fountain, maybe this is the item you buy locally in case it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: nicol schriner

customer_reviews.title: Great until you turn it on.. the Noises
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of it and everything until you turn it on... the sound is so loud. I am gonna do what someone else suggested and put two small 5inch plates on both sides to make the sound stop.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy and Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty and easy to clean - much easier than the ...
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty and easy to clean - much easier than the Drinkwell I had previously. But, like so many others, it's easier to just run the thing without the inner filter that contains the charcoal. It clogs up after just a couple of weeks of use, rendering the pump incapable of its job. No idea where to find good filters for it, so I'll just run it without filters and clean it more often.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L. Ehrhardt

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, didn't work as intended
customer_reviews.text: The first fountain that I purchased had design defects and the porcelain tube the water pump cord goes through was too small for the cord. The second fountain I received was better in design, but the water pump stopped working after 2 weeks. I sadly just returned the second I purchased. I'm disappointed in the fail of this product as I really like the design of the water fountain. I am disappointed that I had to return it and now have to start the search over again for another fountain that'll work. Until they include a better water pump, I wouldn't suggest this fountain.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Yes--Best Pet Fountain Yet
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pet fountain I have ever owned. I like the sound of running water and that sound attracts my cat to drink it. The fountain becomes noisier as the water lowers so keep it full to minimize the sound. The noise level also cues me when it time to refill it. For reasons unknown to me, this fountain stays cleaner than any other I have owned (and I have a half a dozen).
customer_reviews.author: NixB

customer_reviews.title: Gets gunked up too quickly
customer_reviews.text: The design is nice and its super easy to clean. The downside is that you have to clean it so frequently. I have two cats using it and I have to clean it twice a week. A gross film buids up on the porcelain and you burn through filters weekly (if you change it according to the manual). I have used others that are way less expensive and work much better. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY MATERIALS...SAVE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Pump quit working less 4 months....Amazon doesn't carry replacement pump for this design. I only hand washed with liquid dish soap and sponge. The glaze has worn off the tower and bowl where the water runs, which leads to rapid collection & growth of water bowl funk. Concept is good, Cat loved it for the time it worked, and was much easier to clean than other fountains but... POOR QUALITY CERAMIC, FAULTY PUMP = 1 STAR!!!! Far too expensive considering it properly functioned for only 4 months
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: It smelled like photo chemicals
customer_reviews.text: Cat loves it and drinks from it. I can't give it five stars, however, because the larger filter it comes with had a seriously strong chemical smell that wouldn't wash out. It smelled like photo chemicals, and not like anything any creature would willingly ingest. I wound up just omitting it since I don't anticipate large particles getting in here in the first place. Outside of that issue, it's attractive, it makes a pleasing sound (though I can imagine some would think it loud, but I like running water), and the cat likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cholakian

customer_reviews.title: Gravity is only sometimes your friend...
customer_reviews.text: This water fountain is WAY TOO EXPENSIVE for the limited functionality. I have had this 10 months now and the design is flawed. The pump has to push water up against gravity through the filter (which sits on top of the pump) so this thing loses pressure after just a couple days of replacing the filter. So I have replaced the filter way more frequently that I feel I should. Even using name brand filters doesn't work any better than the cheapies. I had high hopes because I thought the porcelain would be more sanitary than plastic, but it hardly circulates the water at all :(
customer_reviews.author: GlowStarGI

customer_reviews.title: Loving it
customer_reviews.text: We've been using our fountain for about a month now and it's great. I've cleaned it twice now and It is easy to clean. There are a lot of parts but after I took it apart for cleaning once it was a breeze to put pack together. I was planning to put the base and tower in the dishwasher but I've been hand washing them since they're no so heavy.
customer_reviews.author: betkes

customer_reviews.title: not to my cats liking....but seemed like a great idea.....
customer_reviews.text: Does seem like it would be great for some cats....not MINE....not interested at all! So disappointed bc would like for him to drink more often. He drinks from my vanity in the evening....and I add some water to his wet food, but other than that no interest in this fountain. It is well made, but does get some sediment from the filter which makes the water look like it has some soot in it.....but instructions say this is OK will not harm your cat...... Sure wish he would take to it....not cheap, and no free returns ($11 for UPS return ....) so make sure your cat is willing to go with the program!!!
customer_reviews.author: analies

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and get this one!
customer_reviews.text: I will start out by saying I have the original Drinkwell fountain but wish I had gotten this one two years ago. It is so much easier to clean. I put filtered water in it and do not use the carbon filter at all. Clean it about once a week and it is good to go. I would buy this again and again for my pets.
customer_reviews.author: Sinda M.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on time and undamaged. I have a dog that does not drink enough water and gets dehydrated. I talk to my vet and she reccommend trying something with moving water as that may encourage her to drink. I read the reviews and bought this item. I could not be happier. Well built and heavier than it looks. It took a couple of days but once she started drinking out of this she is drinking a lot more water every day. She seems to have more energy and happier.
customer_reviews.author: Blane O'Dell

customer_reviews.title: Motor broke after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice-looking fountain, but the motor has broken twice in the year since I bought it. The first time, it started up again, on its own, several hours after it stopped. Then a couple of weeks ago, it stopped for good. It is also harder to clean than plastic fountains because of its weight. Finally, the water in the bowl does not does not recirculate well through the filter, leaving hair, charcoal, and dirt particles in the bowl very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Bad product - pump does not last very long before expiring
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this a one-star review because the pump stopped working even though it was regularly clean and never ran dry within 6 months. You should not have to replace the pump every 6 months if it is well maintained.
customer_reviews.author: pdavis830

customer_reviews.title: pump stopped working 11 days after the return deadline
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this pump for a little over a month and the pump has stopped working. I clean this fountain completely, as in I disassemble the pump as well to clean every nook and cranny every other day, and today it has suddenly stopped turning on. I made sure there was no water damage or anything of the sort and never turned it on without water being present. I will contact the company to see if they will send a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Linh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I’ve made for our cat!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I’ve made for our cat. Our cat wasn’t drinking enough water because he only liked to drink the running water from the faucet. This has solved the problem and he is drinking more water.
customer_reviews.author: Maywad

customer_reviews.title: MY CAT LOVES HER FOUNTAIN
customer_reviews.text: We know the quality of PetSafe, since 4 years ago my cat used a PetSafe Drinkwell Original, still works perfectly but wanted to change it for a ceramic fountain. When I received it I was impressed by the good packaging, fountain was very well protected. Unpack the fountain, wash each of its parts very well and love how easy it was to wash and assemble it. My cat could not wait, and drink water while I tested the operation of the fountain
customer_reviews.author: ALEJANDRA LOZANO ARTEAGA

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for cats to avoid feline acne
customer_reviews.text: We picked up the ceramic pagoda fountain after a bout with feline acne - caused by the Petsafe Platinum (plastic) fountain. Turns out cats eating or drinking from plastic containers can cause them to get zits! Trust me, you don't want your cat to have feline acne - in addition to being painful, it is also annoying and difficult to treat, and the only preventative option is using ceramic for their food and water (and keeping food and water bowls separated, at least a few feet away). We've been happy with the ceramic fountain so far. Relatively easy to assemble, no spilling or splashing so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brontosaurus Rex

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work out for me
customer_reviews.text: My cats definitely drank more water at first but after a while they decided they didn’t like it. Even when I changed the filters often. It was also really loud and gave me headaches so it’s been retired to a cabinet to be sold at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't get this one - I'll tell you which to get instead!
customer_reviews.text: Very noisy. Only 1 filter. Get the iPettie Tritone Ceramic Pet Drinking Fountain instead - it comes with multiple filters, is silent, visually more appealing to humans and still attractive to cats, comparable cost... It's so much better:
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Much better fountain then any of the others!
customer_reviews.text: This fountain is really easy to clean, assemble and disassemble. The filters are designed to flow better and trap gunk out of the water much better than other drinkwell fountains. The porcelain seams to stay cleaner longer and doesn’t get the slimy feeling like the stainless steel fountains. The only downside is it kinda loud because it does pump water fast.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful design but doesn’t work well
customer_reviews.text: I will begin by writing, this is a beautiful water fountain that fits in perfect with our decor. Style-wise, it’s the nicest water fountain we have had. However, after only a few months, the water flow is weak. Per the manual, I have cleaned the pump (I tested it separately and it works full-power) and changed the filters. The water flow is at about 10-20% of the original flow—a dribble really.
customer_reviews.author: Nick A. Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Loved by me and my kitties.
customer_reviews.text: Such a clever design! The way the pump wire is fed through the middle of the fountain, with a rubber cap to keep water from spilling out is both unobtrusive and easy to clean. The porcelain finish and simple square design looks very classy in my home. I do wish the fountain had a variable on it so I could turn the pressure up or down, but the pressure it is set at is sufficient to move the water without being too loud. I also like the two filter design which does an excellent job at keeping fur and debris from the motor. An excellent buy, and my kitties (who have been fountain drinkers all their life) approve as well.
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: The pump is very delicate and can easily break
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this fountain and my cat really likes it. However it does occasionally stop working and if the pump gets jostled around it can stop working. The pump is very difficult to clean mostly in terms of getting it apart. The company also doesn't supply a brush which are now supplied with most humidifiers and other products like this. Also, it has .01% lead in the glaze.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecka Sexton

customer_reviews.title: Peacefully Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: My pups absolutely love drinking from this fountain. I think they drink more now than they have previously with their original dog bowl. I love the sounds of the water trickle.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Rissa

product_meta.title: PetSafe Cat and Dog Water Fountain - Automatic Water Dispenser - Drinkwell Pagoda Ceramic Fountain for Pets - Filter Included - 70 oz
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteKeep your cat healthy, happy and hydrated with the PetSafe Pagoda Ceramic Pet Fountain. This pet fountain has 2 free-falling water streams that encourage your cat or dog to drink more water. Free-falling streams add more oxygen to the water and keep it fresh for your pet. An activated carbon filter removes bad tastes and odors from your pet’s water, and the foam filter helps catch pet hair and other debris to keep the water clean. This fountain holds 70 ounces of water and has an open-bowl design, so if your home loses power, your pet will still have access to water from any side. The elevated, upper bowl is great for senior pets, so they won’t need to bend as low to drink. This ceramic fountain is available in 4 colors to blend seamlessly with your home décor. When it’s time to clean your fountain, simply place the fountain in the top rack of your dishwasher and hand wash the pump separately. PetSafe brand is here to help you and your pet live happy together.
feature_bullets: WATER CAPACITY: 70 oz. water capacity is great for cats and small to medium sized dogs
ENCOURAGES DRINKING: Dual free falling streams add oxygen for freshness and encourage pets to drink more water
FILTERED WATER: Includes replaceable carbon water filter that removes bad tastes and odors, keeping water fresh
TWO BOWL LEVELS: Upper and lower dish provides two drinking areas for pets; elevated dish is great for senior or arthritic pets
HYGIENIC CONSTRUCTION: Ceramic design is more hygienic and looks great in the home
EASY TO CLEAN: Fountain is top-shelf dishwasher safe; Low-voltage 12V system with submersible pump for safe and quiet operation
PRODUCT SUPPORT: PetSafe brand's U.S based Customer Care experts will be glad to help, call Monday through Saturday
EXPERIENCE: PetSafe brand has been an industry leading U.S. manufacturer of pet behavior, containment and lifestyle products since 1991, helping millions of people and pets each year
